description: Immigration removal centres - addresses, contact details visiting hours

parts.body:
You can visit someone in an immigration removal centre or short term holding facility.

Check with the centre:

  • what the visiting hours are
  • if you need to book an appointment
  • what ID you need
  • what items you’re allowed to take with you - you may be searched when you arrive

You may be able to contact someone in a removal centre by phone, email or video call. Contact the immigration removal centre to check.
parts.title: Overview

parts.body:
Email: gatwickirc.visitsbooking@serco.com (to arrange visits)
Email: practiceplusgrp.brookhouse@nhs.net (to request medical records)
Telephone: 01293 566 500 (to arrange visits)
Fax: 01293 566 580 or 01293 566 581
Find out about call charges

Brook House immigration removal centre
Perimeter Road South
London Gatwick Airport
Gatwick
RH6 0PQ

Visiting hours are 2pm to 5:30pm and 6pm to 9pm each day. Last admission is at 8.30pm.

You must book at least one day in advance, between 8am and 9pm.

You must bring the following:

  • passport or travel document
  • driving licence (paper and photo sections)

Or you can bring 2 of the following:

  • birth or marriage certificate
  • rail or bus pass with photo
  • employer’s ID or student card with photo
  • young person’s proof of age card
  • trade union membership card
  • older person’s bus pass
  • benefits book
  • application registration card (ARC)

There’s a free bus service from Atlantic House to Brook House with a stop at Tinsley House. The pick-up point is in front of Atlantic House, just outside Gatwick South Terminal. You can ask about bus times or how to arrange a pick-up when you book your visit.

There’s a free on-site car park. If you use a sat nav, use the street name Perimeter Road South, not the postcode.
parts.title: Brook House, Gatwick

parts.body:
Email: HARVisits@mitie.com (to arrange legal visits - for legal professionals only)
Email: HIRCDomesticVisits@mitie.com (to arrange a social visit)
Email: practiceplusgrp.healthcareheathrowirc@nhs.net (to request medical records)
Telephone: 020 8607 5200

Colnbrook immigration removal centre
Colnbrook Bypass
Harmondsworth
West Drayton
Middlesex
UB7 0FX

Visiting hours are 2pm to 9pm each day. Last admission is at 8.30pm.

You must book your visit in advance.

You must bring the following:

  • photo ID (passport or driving licence)
  • utility bill showing your name and address

Find out how to get to the centre by train or bus
parts.title: Colnbrook, Middlesex

parts.body:
Email: Derwentside.visits@serco.com (for general visits)
Email: DerwentsideIRC@practiceplusgroup.com (for healthcare)
Telephone: 01207 260221

Derwentside immigration removal centre
Corbridge Road
Consett
Co Durham
DH8 6QY

Visiting hours are 9am to midday and 1pm to 9pm each day.

You must book your visit in advance.

You must bring 1 type of photo ID (passport, driving licence, European Community identity card), or 2 of the following:

  • birth or marriage certificate
  • rail or bus pass with photo
  • employer’s ID or student card
  • young person’s proof of age card
  • trade union membership card
  • senior citizen travel pass issued by a local authority
  • benefits book showing you receive welfare payments
  • Home Office application registration card

There’s a free shuttle bus and taxi service from Durham bus or train station to Derwentside. Ask for further information when you book your visit.
parts.title: Derwentside, County Durham

parts.body:
Email: dungavel.visits@mitiecc.com (to arrange all visits - including legal visits)
Email: dungavelhc@lanarkshire.scot.nhs.uk (to request medical records) Telephone: 01698 395 000

Dungavel House immigration removal centre
Strathaven
South Lanarkshire
ML10 6RF

Legal visiting hours are 9am to midday and 1pm to 9pm each day.

Social visiting hours are:

  • 1pm to 9pm, Monday to Friday
  • 9am to midday and 1pm to 9pm, Saturday and Sunday

You must book your visit in advance.

You must bring 1 type of photo ID (passport, driving licence, European Community identity card), or 2 of the following:

  • birth or marriage certificate
  • rail or bus pass with photo
  • employer’s ID or student card
  • young person’s proof of age card
  • trade union membership card
  • senior citizen travel pass issued by a local authority
  • benefits book showing you receive welfare payments
  • Home Office application registration card

There’s a free taxi service from the nearest bus or train station to Dungavel House. Ask for this when you book your visit.
parts.title: Dungavel House, South Lanarkshire

parts.body:
Email: HARVisits@mitie.com (to arrange legal visits - for legal professionals only)
Email: HIRCDomesticVisits@mitie.com (to arrange a social visit)
Email: practiceplusgrp.healthcareheathrowirc@nhs.net (to request medical records)
Telephone: 020 8607 5200

Harmondsworth immigration removal centre
Colnbrook-by-pass
Harmondsworth
West Drayton
Middlesex
UB7 0HB

Visiting hours are 2pm to 9pm each day. Last admission is at 8.30pm.

You must book your visit in advance.

You must bring the following:

  • photo ID (a passport or driving licence)
  • utility bill showing your name and address

Find out how to get to the centre by train or bus
parts.title: Harmondsworth, Middlesex

parts.body:
Telephone: 028 2826 2070

Larne House short term holding facility
2 Hope Street
Larne
Antrim
BT40 1UR

Visiting hours are 2pm to 9pm each day – you must book in advance.

You must bring the following:

  • photo ID (passport or driving licence)
  • utility bill showing your name and address
parts.title: Larne House short term holding facility, Antrim

parts.body:
Telephone: 0161 509 2015

Manchester short term holding facility
Building 302
Argosy Drive
World Freight Terminal
Manchester Airport
M90 5PZ

Visiting hours are 2pm to 9pm each day. You must book in advance.

You must bring the following:

  • photo ID (passport or driving licence)
  • utility bill showing your name and address

Follow the signs to World Freight Terminal. Building 302 is on the right hand side of the road.
parts.title: Manchester short term holding facility

parts.body:
Telephone: 01522 302665

Swinderby short term holding facility
Park Crescent
Eagle Road
Swinderby
Lincoln
LN6 9HU

Visiting hours are 2pm to 9pm Monday to Friday. You must book in advance.

You must bring the following:

  • photo ID (passport or driving licence)
  • utility bill showing your name and address

The nearest train station is Swinderby station.

​​There’s also Newark Northgate (9 miles away) or Lincoln (12 miles away).
parts.title: Swinderby short term holding facility

parts.body:
Email: gatwickirc.visitsbooking@serco.com (to arrange visits)
Email: practiceplusgrp.brookhouse@nhs.net (to request medical records) Telephone: 01293 434 800
Find out about call charges

Tinsley House immigration removal centre
Perimeter Road South
Gatwick Airport
Gatwick
West Sussex
RH6 0PQ

Gatwick pre-departure accommodation (part of Tinsley House)
Perimeter Road South
Gatwick Airport
Gatwick
West Sussex
RH6 0PQ

Visiting hours are 2pm to 5.30pm and 6pm to 9pm each day. Last admission is at 8:30pm.

You must book at least one day in advance, between 8am and 9pm.

Everyone who visits must have ID, including children. You must bring one of the following:

  • passport or travel document
  • driving licence (paper and photo sections)

Or you can bring 2 of the following:

  • birth or marriage certificate
  • rail or bus pass with photo
  • employer’s ID or student card
  • young person’s proof of age card
  • trade union membership card
  • older person’s bus pass
  • benefits book
  • application registration card (ARC)

There’s a free bus service from Atlantic House to Tinsley House with a stop at Brook House. The pick-up point is in front of Atlantic House, just outside Gatwick South Terminal. You can ask about bus times or how to arrange a pick-up when you book your visit.

There’s a free on-site car park. If you use a sat nav, use the street name Perimeter Road South, not the postcode.
parts.title: Tinsley House, Gatwick

parts.body:
Email: yarls-wood-visitors-centre@serco.com (to arrange visits)
Email: yarlswoodirc.healthcare@nhs.net (to request medical records) Telephone: 01234 821 000

Yarl's Wood immigration removal centre
Twinwoods Business Park
Thurleigh Road
Milton Ernest
Bedford
MK44 2FQ

Visiting hours are 2pm to 5pm and 6pm to 9pm each day.

You must book at least one day in advance.

You must bring the following:

  • photo ID (passport or driving licence)
  • utility bill showing your name and address

There’s a bus service between Bedford station and Yarl’s Wood.
parts.title: Yarl's Wood, Bedfordshire
